intro: Clinopodium macrocalyx, commonly known as large-leaved hedge nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges, and produces small, pink to purple flowers in whorled clusters. Its hairy stems and leaves are often covered in fine, glandular trichomes, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Clinopodium macrocalyx is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in woodlands and along streambanks.
